intro: Mikaniopsis usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambarensis Mikaniopsis, is a climbing plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and its leaves are alternate and often lobed. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
